virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::dispatchDragEvent ( const DragEvent &  event) [virtual]
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::dispatchKeyEvent ( const KeyEvent &  event) [virtual]

Dispatch a key event to the next widget on the focus path.

This path runs from the top of the widget tree down to the currently focused widget. If this widget has focus, it will dispatch to itself. Otherwise it will dispatch the next node down the focus path. This method also fires any key listeners.

Parameters:
eventThe event to be dispatched
Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::dispatchKeyEventPreIme ( const KeyEvent &  event) [virtual]

Dispatch a key event before it is processed by any input method associated with the widget hierarchy.

This can be used to intercept key events in special situations before the IME consumes them; a typical example would be handling the BACK key to update the application's UI instead of allowing the IME to see it and close itself.

Parameters:
eventThe key event to be dispatched.
Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::dispatchTouchEvent ( const MotionEvent &  event) [virtual]

Pass the touch screen motion event down to the target widget, or this widget if it is the target.

Parameters:
eventThe event to be dispatched
Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.

virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onDragEvent ( const DragEvent &  event) [virtual]
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onGenericMotionEvent ( const MotionEvent &  event) [virtual]

Implement this function to handle generic motion events.

Generic motion events describe joystick movements, mouse hovers, track pad touches, scroll wheel movements and other input events. The source of the motion event specifies the class of input that was received. Implementations of this function must examine the bits in the source before processing the event. The following code example shows how this is done.

Generic motion events with source class InputDevice::SOURCE_CLASS_POINTER are delivered to the widget under the pointer. All other generic motion events are delivered to the focused widget. 

        bool onGenericMotionEvent(const MotionEvent& event) {
            if ((event.getSource() & InputDevice::SOURCE_CLASS_JOYSTICK) != 0) {
                if (event.getAction() == MotionEvent::ACTION_MOVE) {
                    // process the joystick movement...
                    return true;
                }
            }
            if ((event.getSource() & InputDevice::SOURCE_CLASS_POINTER) != 0) {
                switch (event.getAction()) {
                case MotionEvent::ACTION_HOVER_MOVE:
                    // process the mouse hover movement...
                    return true;
                case MotionEvent::ACTION_SCROLL:
                    // process the scroll wheel movement...
                    return true;
                }
            }
            return TextWidget::onGenericMotionEvent(event);
        }
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onInterceptTouchEvent ( const MotionEvent &  event) [virtual]

Implement this method to intercept all touch screen motion events.

This allows you to watch events as they are dispatched to your children, and take ownership of the current gesture at any point.

Using this function takes some care, as it has a fairly complicated interaction with EventControl::onTouchEvent(MotionEvent), and using it requires implementing that method as well as this one in the correct way. Events will be received in the following order: <1> You will receive the down event here. <2> The down event will be handled either by a child of this widget group, or given to your own onTouchEvent() method to handle; this means you should implement onTouchEvent() to return true, so you will continue to see the rest of the gesture (instead of looking for a parent widget to handle it). Also, by returning true from onTouchEvent(), you will not receive any following events in onInterceptTouchEvent() and all touch processing must happen in onTouchEvent() like normal. <3> For as long as you return false from this function, each following event (up to and including the final up) will be delivered first here and then to the target's onTouchEvent(). <4> If you return true from here, you will not receive any following events: the target widget will receive the same event but with the action MotionEvent#ACTION_CANCEL, and all further events will be delivered to your onTouchEvent() method and no longer appear here.

Parameters:
eventThe motion event being dispatched down the hierarchy.
Returns:
Return true to steal motion events from the children and have them dispatched to this EventControl through onTouchEvent(). The current target will receive an ACTION_CANCEL event, and no further messages will be delivered here.
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onKeyDown ( int32_t  keyCode,
const KeyEvent &  event 
) [virtual]

Default UI control: perform press of the widget when KeyEvent#KEYCODE_DPAD_CENTER or KeyEvent#KEYCODE_ENTER is released, if the widget is enabled and clickable.

Parameters:
keyCodeA key code that represents the button pressed, from KeyEvent.
eventThe KeyEvent object that defines the button action.
virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onKeyLongPress ( int32_t  keyCode,
const KeyEvent &  event

Default UI control: always returns false (doesn't handle the event).

int32_t  repeatCount,
const KeyEvent &  event

Default UI control: always returns false (doesn't handle the event).

Parameters:
keyCodeA key code that represents the button pressed, from KeyEvent.
repeatCountThe number of times the action was made.

virtual bool gaia::core::EventControl::onKeyPreIme ( int32_t  keyCode,
const KeyEvent &  event 
) [virtual]

Handle a key event before it is processed by any input method associated with the widget hierarchy.

This can be used to intercept key events in special situations before the IME consumes them; a typical example would be handling the BACK key to update the application's UI instead of allowing the IME to see it and close itself.

Parameters:
keyCodeThe value in event.getKeyCode().
eventDescription of the key event.
Returns:
If you handled the event, return true. If you want to allow the event to be handled by the next receiver, return false.

void gaia::core::EventControl::setOnClickListener ( OnClickListener *  l)

Register a callback to be invoked when this widget is clicked.

If this widget is not clickable, it becomes clickable.

Parameters:
lThe callback that will run
void gaia::core::EventControl::setOnDragListener ( OnDragListener *  l)

Register a drag event listener callback object for this Widget.

The parameter is an implementation of OnDragListener. To send a drag event to a Widget, the system calls the OnDragListener::onDrag(Widget, DragEvent) method.
